tips.title: Use Strong, Unique Passwords
tips.description: Create passwords that are at least 12 characters long and include a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols.

tips.title: Enable Two-Factor Authentication
tips.description: Add an extra layer of security by enabling 2FA on all your important accounts. This requires a second form of verification beyond your password.

tips.title: Use a Password Manager
tips.description: Password managers generate, store, and autofill strong passwords for all your accounts, making it easy to use unique passwords everywhere.

tips.title: Avoid Common Password Mistakes
tips.description: Never use personal information, common words, or sequential patterns in your passwords. Don't reuse passwords across multiple accounts.

tips.title: Verify Email Senders
tips.description: Always check the sender's email address carefully. Legitimate companies use their official domain names.

tips.title: Be Wary of Urgent Requests
tips.description: Phishers often create a sense of urgency. Legitimate companies rarely demand immediate action via email.

tips.title: Hover Before You Click
tips.description: Hover over links in emails to see the actual destination URL before clicking. Look for suspicious or misspelled domains.

tips.title: Contact Companies Directly
tips.description: If you're unsure about an email, contact the company directly using official contact information from their website.

tips.title: Review Privacy Settings
tips.description: Regularly review and update privacy settings on social media platforms and other online services.

tips.title: Use VPN on Public Wi-Fi
tips.description: When using public Wi-Fi, use a VPN to encrypt your internet traffic and protect your data from potential eavesdroppers.

tips.title: Be Careful with App Permissions
tips.description: Before downloading apps, review the permissions they request. Only grant necessary permissions and avoid apps that ask for excessive access.

tips.title: Limit Personal Information Sharing
tips.description: Be cautious about what personal information you share online. The less information available, the harder it is for attackers to target you.

tips.title: Keep Software Updated
tips.description: Regularly update your operating system, web browsers, and other software to patch security vulnerabilities.

tips.title: Use Antivirus Software
tips.description: Install and regularly update reputable antivirus software to detect and remove malware from your devices.

tips.title: Be Cautious with Downloads
tips.description: Only download software from official websites or trusted app stores. Avoid downloading files from suspicious or unknown sources.

tips.title: Enable Firewall Protection
tips.description: Use a firewall to block unauthorized access to your computer and network. Most operating systems include built-in firewalls.

tips.title: Backup Your Data
tips.description: Regularly backup important files to external drives or cloud storage. This protects against data loss from malware or hardware failure.

tips.title: Secure Your Home Network
tips.description: Change default router passwords, enable WPA3 encryption, and use a strong Wi-Fi password to protect your home network.

tips.title: Be Skeptical of Free Offers
tips.description: Be cautious of emails or websites offering free software, prizes, or deals that seem too good to be true.

tips.title: Educate Yourself Continuously
tips.description: Stay informed about the latest cybersecurity threats and best practices. Security awareness is your best defense.
